title: August Oetker
text:
August Oetker (; January 6, 1862 – January 10, 1918) was a German inventor, food scientist and businessman. He is known as the creator of <a href="baking%20powder">baking powder</a> as a ready-to-use product, and also as the founder of the <a href="Dr.%20Oetker">Dr. Oetker</a> company.
Biography.
Early life.
Oetker was born on January 6, 1862, in <a href="Obernkirchen">Obernkirchen</a>, Germany.
Career.
In 1891, he bought the Aschoffsche pharmacy in <a href="Bielefeld">Bielefeld</a> and developed a baking agent, which was designed to ensure the success of the baking process. Prior to Oetker, a British chemist, <a href="Alfred%20Bird">Alfred Bird</a>, had already invented baking powder.
From 1890, he distributed his invention under the brand name "Backin", thus laying the basis for the family-owned company, called <a href="Oetker-Gruppe">Oetker-Gruppe</a>. The company still uses the very same recipe to produce baking powder. On September 21, 1909, Oetker filed a patent for his "Procedure for making long-lasting baking powder or ready-to-bake flour".
Due to successful marketing, his products sold quite well and soon the old pharmacy had turned into a successful company. In 1900, Oetker built his first manufacturing plant and, by 1906, had sold 50 million packages of Backin.
Death and legacy.
Oetker died on January 10, 1918, in <a href="Bielefeld">Bielefeld</a>, Germany. Later, his grandson, <a href="Rudolf%20August%20Oetker">Rudolf August Oetker</a>, took over the company.
Motto: ("A bright mind always uses Oetker.").
